alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 6:10PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN COOK AND NORTHERN LAKE COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM CDT... At 609 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 36 miles east of Kettle Falls, to 6 miles southeast of Rainy Lake East, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Northwestern portions of the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness around 620 PM CDT. Alpine Lake, Snowbank Lake and Saganaga Lake around 710 PM CDT. Little Saganaga Lake and Sea Gull Lake around 715 PM CDT. Gunflint Lake around 725 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Ensign Lake, Hudson Lake, Brule Lake, Lac la Croix, Kekekabic Lake, Cherokee Lake, Thomas Lake, Alice Lake, Knife Lake and Ojibway Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. These storms may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
